title: Kevin Hart shares his incredible recovery from hospital to walking again after horror crash
text:

Kevin Hart has laid bare the recovery process following the car crash.

The stand-up comedian had fractured his spine in three places after his 1970 Plymouth Barracuda come off the Mulholland Highway and plunged down a gully.

Kevin, who has now returned to work, has been in recovery since the vehicle ploughed through a wooden fence in the horror smash on September 1.

Now the funny man has shared his personal journey with his 80.4million Instagram followers on Wednesday.

In an emotional sequence, Kevin could be seen being lifted out of a hospital bed onto two crutches.

The Night School star admitted he was "out of control" but he said the accident forced him to slow down and change the way he sees the world.

(Image: Instagram)

He said in the voice over: "Basically what you realise is even though you think you're in control, you're not in control. At the end of day, it can all be over.

"When God talks you gotta listen. I swear life is funny because some of the craziest things that happen to you end up being the thing that you needed most.

"In this case, I feel God basically told me I need to sit down. You're moving too fast, doing too much. You can't see the things you're meant to see. After my accident, you see things differently."

(Image: Instagram)

As time passes, the heart-rendering clip also showed the American regaining his strength as he started training at the gym again and swimming.

Kevin said he was appreciative for his family, friends and fans as he

He said: "My appreciation for life is through the roof. I'm thankful for my family, my friends, the people who simply ride with me and stay with me because they stood by me.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

"My fans, thanks for all your love and support. So don't take today for granted because tomorrow isn't promised. I'm thankful for god for life... Looking forward to an amazing 2020."

Kevin was in the back seat with Rebecca Broxterman while her fiancé and Hart's friend Jared Black was the driver at the time of the accident.

The pair are now reportedly preparing to sue Kevin over their injuries, claiming he was negligent in not having the requisite safety features included in the rebuild, which was a birthday present to himself.

The injured couple are arguing that the classic car did not have proper safety harnesses or airbags.

These safety features are common in cars nowadays but not in 1970 when the Barracuda was originally built but could have been included in the rebuild.

The car had a powerful 720 horsepower engine and it has been reported that the safety features should have been a minimum requirement but Kevin wanted 'authenticity'.
description: Kevin divulged all the details of his recovery with his fans in an emotional video shared on Instagram
